Package engine

Class Rules

java.lang.Object
engine.Rules
public class Rules
extends java.lang.Object
this class contains the main logic of the game as well as all the rules.
Author:
Virgil SURIN

  • Field Details

    • startMark

      private static final Coord startMark
      it's a coord code that marks the start.

      it's a coord code that indicates that there are no path.

      private static final Coord goalMark
      it's a coord code that marks the goal

  • Constructor Details

    • Rules

      public Rules()

  • Method Details

    • canMove

      public static boolean canMove​(PawnController ctrl, Coord direction)
      from the controller position, tells if it can move into the given direction.
      Parameters:
      ctrl - the controller, take is current position to check.
      direction - the direction we are checking with.
      Returns:
      true if there is no obstacle from the controller coordinates to the given direction, false otherwise.

    • canMove

      public static boolean canMove​(PawnController ctrl, Coord direction, Coord currentCoord)
      does the same as the 2 parameters canMove but it checks from a given coordinates instead of the controller's coordinates.
      Parameters:
      ctrl - the controller, used to get the board in this case.
      direction - the direction we are checking with.
      currentCoord - the coordinates from which we are looking.
      Returns:
      true if there is no obstacle from the currentCoord in the given direction.

    • canPlaceWall

      public static boolean canPlaceWall​(PawnController[] playerArray, PawnController ctrl, Coord origin, Coord direction)
      is a global verification combining validPlacement(Coord, Coord, Board) and pathOrNot(PawnController). It checks if the wall the controller wants to place does not get Out Of Bounds (OOB), does not cut or stacks up to an existing wall or if it does not prevent a controller from finding a path to it's objective.
      Parameters:
      playerArray - array containing all the PawnController playing in the game.
      ctrl - the controller who wants to place a wall.
      origin - the coordinates where a controller wants to place a wall
      direction - the direction the controller wants to give to the wall.
      Returns:
      true if the wall that the controller wants to place does not break any rules, false otherwise.

    • validPlacement

      public static boolean validPlacement​(Coord coord, Coord direction, Board board)
      This method will check if the wall a controller wants to place does not get Out Of Bounds (OOB), if it does not cut an already placed wall and if it does not stack up on an existing wall.
      Parameters:
      coord - the coordinates of the cell at which we want to place a wall.
      direction - the direction of the wall, used to build its second part.
      board - the board in which the game takes place.
      Returns:
      true if the wall does not enter in collision with an existing wall, false otherwise.

    • hasWon

      public static boolean hasWon​(Coord coord, PawnController ctrl)
      checks if the coord full-fill the winning condition.
      Parameters:
      coord - the coordinates we're comparing to.
      ctrl - the controller we're looking at.
      Returns:
      true if the coordinates correspond to the objective of the controller, false otherwise.

    • finAPath

      public static java.util.Hashtable<Coord,​Coord> finAPath​(PawnController ctrl)
      It searches a path to the goal row of the controller's dependency starting from it's current coordinates. It starts to explore the surrounding of the controller's position in the board then it does the same for each newly discovered position. The idea behind this algorithm is the breadth-first search
      Parameters:
      ctrl - the controller for which we seek a path to victory if there is one.
      Returns:
      an Hashtable, if there is a path, it contains the startMark and the goalMark and all the coordinates that have been explored. It needs to be translated into a path. If there is no path, it's a one key one value Hashtable where the key is the noPathMark.

    • explore

      public static int explore​(java.util.Hashtable<Coord,​Coord> exploredTable, java.util.ArrayList<Coord> exploredCoord, java.util.ArrayList<Coord> toBeExplored, PawnController ctrl)
      part of the breadth-first search, will explore all the surrounding positions and then repeat Each newly discovered position is added at the beginning of the toBeExplored list. Exploration begins by the end of this list.
      Parameters:
      exploredTable - the Hashtable containing all the explored positions.
      exploredCoord - contains all the coordinates that have been marked as explored.
      toBeExplored - the queue. All the positions that needs to be explored.
      ctrl - the controller.
      Returns:
      1 if a path to the objective has been found. 0 if a path to the objective hasn't been found yet. 2 if every possible positions have been explored but none of the is the objective, in other words, there is no path.s

    • pathOrNot

      public static boolean pathOrNot​(PawnController ctrl)
      Interprets the Hashtable given by findAPath into a boolean result depending if there is a path from the controller's position to its objective by checking the presence of goalMark or noPathMark.
      Parameters:
      ctrl - the controller.
      Returns:
      true if there is a path from the controller's position to its objective, false otherwise.

    • path

      public static java.util.ArrayList<Coord> path​(PawnController ctrl)
      this method translate the exploredTab of findAPath into a list containing the path to follow. It starts at the goalMark and go from key to value until it gets at the startMark.
      Parameters:
      ctrl - the controller
      Returns:
      a list containing the path to follow.
